greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into parts 8k and 8k+2 with at least one part of each type.
link: Robert Price, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: nmax = 81; s1 = Range[1, nmax/8]*8; s2 = Range[0, nmax/8]*8 + 2;
x_ /; ContainsAny[x, s1 ] && ContainsAny[x, s2 ]], {n, 1, nmax}] (* _Robert Price_, Aug 12 2020 *)
nmax = 81; l = Rest@CoefficientList[Series[(-1 + 1/Product[(1 - x^(8 k)), {k, 1, nmax}])*(-1 + 1/Product[(1 - x^(8 k + 2)), {k, 0, nmax}]), {x, 0, nmax}], x]  (* _Robert Price_, Aug 12 2020 *)
xref: Bisections give: A035621 (even part), A000004 (odd part).
results.author: _Olivier Gérard_
